articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The congresswoman's son, 18, has been charged with multiple felonies over his alleged role in car break-ins.
articles.title: Lauren Boebert's son Tyler arrested, leaving congresswoman 'heartbroken'

articles.description: After Prince William suddenly withdrew from an event, worries for his wife Kate grew louder - leaving the Palace with a dilemma.
articles.title: Analysis: A royal dilemma as public curiosity over Kate grows

articles.description: There are conflicting reports about how many Palestinians were shot by Israeli forces or run over by aid lorries.
articles.title: Israel-Gaza war: More than 100 reported killed in crowd near Gaza aid convoy, Hamas-run health ministry says

articles.description: The fire in the capital Dhaka is reported to be contained and dozens more people have been rescued.
articles.title: Bangladesh fire: At least 43 dead in Dhaka building blaze

articles.description: Alexei Navalny's team say undertakers have been warned not to provide a vehicle to carry his body.
articles.title: Alexei Navalny: 'No hearse for body' as family prepares funeral

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Dance You Outta My Head hit maker was diagnosed with a rare cancer, called sarcoma, in 2022.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Canada has seen a surge of asylum claims from the country, many of which are withdrawn or rejected.
articles.title: Canada reimposes visas requirements for Mexicans as asylum claims surge

articles.description: Red Bull team principal Christian Horner denies allegations of inappropriate behaviour again after a series of alleged messages are leaked.

articles.description: The Cuban government says it needs help providing children under seven years with subsidised milk.
articles.title: Cuba asks UN for help as food shortages worsen

articles.description: Manuel Rocha was charged with secretly passing information to the Cuban government since 1981.
